projects.name: HikeBite
projects.subtitle:
For my 10-week capstone project, I worked with Will Labeaux and Wolfgang Loudenburg to create HikeBite.

HikeBite is an iOS app designed to assist beginner backpackers with meal planning. The app allows users to create trips and populate them with meal ideas, either from a pre-made template (provided by the CU Hiking Club) or by hand-selecting meals from our database. Each meal plan is entirely customizable by the user. The user can also upload their own meals if they create an account!

I was the sole app developer on this project. I built the app on SwiftUI with Xcode. I used Firebase to create the backend, utilizing Firebase Storage to store our photos, Firebase Authentication to authorize our users, and the Firestore Database to store meal ideas, templates, and users' information. I used Swift Data for offline use. Will created our two formal documentation videos (youtube links above), designed the UI, and conducted user research. Wolfgang created our website, conducted user testing, and populated our database with meal ideas and templates from his research.

projects.name: Bayou Bolt
projects.subtitle: Bayou Bolt is a New Orleans themed 2D scrolling jumping platform tiny game. It is influenced by Super Mario. Bayou Bolt is coded in Lua and designed with Pico-8 for its sprite and map editor.

projects.name: Frog Soup
projects.subtitle: Frog Soup is a game created with Bitsy.org.

projects.name: Dodge the Cracks
projects.subtitle: Dodge the Cracks is a game created with Vanilla JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. It was inspired by the  game, Flappy Bird.

projects.name: Frustrating Phone Number Enter-er
projects.subtitle: This frustrating, but functional, phone number enter-er was built with HTML, CSS, and Javascript. It was inspired by combining the concepts of Wild-West carnival games and rotary phones into one shooting game.

projects.name: CRyder and Dirty Beets Informational Webpage
projects.subtitle: CRyder and Dirty Beets is a local band in Colorado. They asked me to build a webpage highlighting the band's musical style and accomplishments. I used HTML, CSS, and Javascript to create this site. I conducted UX Research to determine the best layout and design for their site and branding.

projects.name: Zane McMorris Personal Portfolio
projects.subtitle: Zane McMorris is an electrical computer engineer at CU Boulder. He asked me to build him a personal portfolio where he can show off his projects.  I used HTML, CSS, and Javascript to create this site.

projects.name: Recipe Search + Grocery List App
projects.subtitle: This app employs the Spoonacular's API to search for recipes. The user can add the ingredients from the recipe to their grocery list and mark them off when completed. They can also delete items from their grocery list. The grocery list is stored in Swift Data. It also has an iOS widget built with WidgetKit that allows the user to easily navigate to their grocerylist.

projects.name: Dinosaur Calculation App
projects.subtitle: DinoMatch is an app that allows users to compare their height and speed to that of a dinosaur. They can also take the dinosaur personality quiz to see which dinosaur most closely matches their personality. The app was built with Swift and Xcode.

projects.name: Natural Highs App Prototype
projects.subtitle:
One of the projects I have been working on is a prototype app for Natural Highs, a nonprofit organization dedicated to teaching healthy alternatives to substances. I utilized Figma to make the prototype.

The app is a social media page for the nonprofit. You create an account where you input your information and demographics. When you sign up, you automatically follow all the main pages (Boulder, Canada, Australia) and all the registered peer mentors from your community. After signing in, the app automatically loads the feed page. From there, you can navigate throughout the app. There is an events page where you can scan a QR code to check in for each event. After checking in, users are asked to fill out a survey with the information needed for Natural Highs to apply for grants. The app has a database holding the demographics of each user along with their answers to surveys.

projects.name: Wonderland Mirror-Puzzle Maze
projects.subtitle: I developed a VR puzzle maze. The theme was inspired by the Queen of Heart's maze and palace from Alice in Wonderland. My puzzle features were inspired by Portal. I used Unity, C#, and a Meta Quest 3.

projects.name: Martian Shooter
projects.subtitle: I developed a VR shooting game with Unity, C#, and a Meta Quest 3.

projects.name: Chart Generator from Spreadsheet
projects.subtitle: I developed this web-app to generate charts using data from uploaded spreadsheets. I used Sveltekit and Next.js to build this chart generator.  Firebase stores user's login credentials and uploaded files. Chart.js converts the spreadsheets to charts.

projects.name: React.js Meal Planner
projects.subtitle: This React.js web-app allows users to input their meals and ingredients for the week and populate their meal plan with an easy drag and drop feature. I collaborated with Wolfgang Loudenburg to build this app.
